description.value: When a Kaml file has been broken into individual files to be packaged up as a single Kaml file when requested, if a template has an associated script or css file, it can be supplied via `script`, `script.setup` (to run one time on the first render of a template), or `css` attribute values which specify the 'name' segment of the supporting file name (i.e. `script='email.script'` for a Kaml file named `Templates.Email.kaml`, the supporting file would be `Templates.Email.kaml.email.script.js`.  When providing supporting file name attributes, the `local-kaml-package` attribute must contain `template.items` key.
Supporting file segment name that requests a javascript file with name `{View.kaml}.{script}.js` that should run every time a template is rendered.
Supporting file segment name that requests a javascript file with name `{View.kaml}.{script.setup}.js` that should run one time on the initial render of a template.
Supporting file segment name that requests a css file with name `{View.kaml}.{css}.css` that should run one time on the initial render of a template.

Use the `rbl-config` tag to define the configuration for a KatApp Framework application and its RBLe calculation(s).  The `rbl-config` tag must be present and the first element of a Kaml view.

Available attributes are `templates` and `no-kaml-package`.
Comma delimitted list of Kaml Template Files required by this Kaml View. Each template is specified in Folder:FileName syntax.

When a Kaml file has been broken into individual files to be packaged up as a single Kaml file when requested, if a developer is working in [debugResourcesDomain](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#IKatAppDebugOptions) mode, to minimize the noise of 404 errors present in the browser console, the supporting file types to process must be specified as a comma delimitted list.  The available types are `js` (file for Kaml javascript), `css` (file for Kaml CSS), `templates` (file for Kaml templates), or `js.templates` (process all templates in file looking for `script` or `script.setup` attributes which point to supporting file).

If one or more CalcEngines are used in Kaml View, specify each one via a `calc-engine` element.

Available attributes are `name`, `key`, `input-tab`, `result-tabs`, `configure-ui` and `precalcs`.

Optional; When more than one CalcEngine is provided (or if you need to access [Manual Results](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#imanualtabdef)), a CalcEngine is referenced by this key; usually via a `ce` property passed into a Vue directive.
The name of the CalcEngine.
Optional; The name of the tab where KatApp framework should inject inputs. Default is `RBLInput`.

Optional; Comma delimitted list of result tabs to process during RBLe Calculation. When more than one result tab is provided, the tab is referenced by name; usually via a `tab` property passed into a Vue directive. Default is `RBLResult`.
Optional; Whether or not this CalcEngine should run during the Kaml View's original [Configure UI Calculation](#IKatApp.configureUICalculation). Default is `true`.

Optional; Comma delimitted list of CalcEngines, i.e. `CalcEngine1,CalcEngineN` to use in a a [Precalc Pipeline](#Precalc Pipelines) for the current CalcEngine. .  By default, if only a CalcEngine name is provided, the input and the result tab with the *same* name as the tabs configured on the primary CalcEngine will be used.  To use different tabs, each PreCalc CalcEngine 'entity' becomes `CalcEngine|InputTab|ResultTab`.
Hook up event handlers when the current element is rendered (i.e. `@vue:mounted="handlers.someHandler"`).
Flag an element so that any contained [`v-ka-input`](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-ka-input) elements do not trigger a RBLe calculation upon change.

Flag an element so that any contained [`v-ka-input`](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-ka-input) elements do not trigger a RBLe calculation upon change **and** are never submitted to an RBLe calculation.

Flag an element so that when any contained [`v-ka-input`](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-ka-input) elements are removed from the DOM, the associated [`state.inputs`](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#iapplicationdatainputs) value is also removed.

Flag an element so that any contained [`v-ka-input`](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-ka-input) elements allow for the KatApp framework to wire up all automatic processing.

Use the `v-pre` directive to an element that is used for [IModalOptions.contentSelector](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#imodaloptionscontentselector) if the markup within the element should not be processed by the host application, but instead should be processed and become reactive when the modal application is created.

globalAttributes.name: v-scope
globalAttributes.description: Use v-scope to append a 'scope' to the currently running petite-vue scope.

globalAttributes.name: v-effect
globalAttributes.description: Use v-effect to execute **reactive** inline statements:

globalAttributes.name: v-if
globalAttributes.description: Conditionally render this element based on Vue expression.

globalAttributes.name: v-html
globalAttributes.description: Updated the element's InnerHTML with given Vue expression.

globalAttributes.name: v-text
globalAttributes.description: Updated the element's text content with given Vue expression.

globalAttributes.name: v-bind
globalAttributes.description: Dynamically bind one or more attributes to a Vue expression.  Prefer the :attributeName short-hand syntax.
Dynamically bind an attribute to a Vue expression.

globalAttributes.name: :class
globalAttributes.description: Dynamically bind the class attribute to a Vue expression.

globalAttributes.name: :data-
globalAttributes.description: Dynamically bind a data attribute to a Vue expression.

globalAttributes.name: v-for
globalAttributes.description: Render the element or template block multiple times based on the source data.

globalAttributes.name: v-on
globalAttributes.description: Attach an event listener to the element.  Prefer the @eventName short-hand syntax.

globalAttributes.name: @click
globalAttributes.description: Attach a click event listener to the element.

globalAttributes.name: @click.prevent
globalAttributes.description: Attach a click event listener to the element and prevent event bubbling.

globalAttributes.name: v-show
globalAttributes.description: Toggle the element's visibility based on the truthy-ness of the Vue expression value.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-value
globalAttributes.description:
Update element's innerHTML from designated RBLe Framework result. The v-ka-value directive is responsible for assigning element HTML content from the calculation results. It is simply a shorthand syntax to use in place of `v-html` and [`rbl.value()`](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#iapplicationdatarblvalue). The following statements are 'equivalent': ```html
``` This directive is almost equivalent to `v-html="rbl.value(...)"` with a single caveat. When the requested value does not exist in the calculation results, `rbl.value()` returns `undefined` and that would be rendered if the `v-html` directive was used. With `v-ka-value`, when the value does not exist, the element's current HTML is left unmodified.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-resource
globalAttributes.description: When a KatApp needs to support localization (different language translations), the `v-ka-resource` can work in conjunction with the [`IKatAppOptions.resourceStrings`](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#ikatappoptions) to replace the element's `innerHTML` with a translated string.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-input
globalAttributes.description: Render input template or bind existing inputs to RBLe Framework calculations.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-input-group
globalAttributes.description: Render template representing multiple inputs of the same type and bind to RBLe Framework calculations.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-navigate
globalAttributes.description: Configure navigation within Kaml Views to other Kaml Views in Host Environment.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-template
globalAttributes.description: Render template with or without a data source; the data source can be an array rendering template content multiple times.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-api
globalAttributes.description: Configure a HTMLElement to submit to an api endpoint on click event.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-modal
globalAttributes.description: Configure a HTMLElement to open up a modal dialog (containing fixed markup or seperate Kaml View) on click.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-app
globalAttributes.description: Nest an instance of a seperate Kaml View within the current Kaml View (the KatApps will be isolated from each other).

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-table
globalAttributes.description: Render HTML tables automatically from the calculation results based on `text*` and `value*` columns.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-highchart
globalAttributes.description: Render Highcharts chart automatically from the calculation results.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-attributes
globalAttributes.description:
Accepts a key/value space delimitted `string` of attributes and applies them to the current `HTMLElement`. **Model** ```javascript row: { "@id": "123", attributes: "data-show=\"profile1\" data-context=\"profile\"" } ``` **Markup** ```html
```

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-needs-calc
globalAttributes.description: Control UI state when a submission form requires a RBLe Framework calculation before user can click the 'submit' button.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-inline
globalAttributes.description: Render raw HTML without the need for a `HTMLElement` 'container'.

globalAttributes.name: v-ka-nomount
globalAttributes.description: There are some situations where inputs should not be automatically processed (i.e. if a template has hidden inputs that are for internal use only - i.e. file upload templates). When an input should not be processed, the v-ka-nomount attribute can be applied to the input.
